background: The Nez Perce Tribe's Department of Fisheries Resources Management utilize spawning ground surveys to gather information from returning anadromous adult salmonids (e.g. Chinook salmon, steelhead, Coho salmon). Information is used for life history, abundance and productivity monitoring in the Snake River Basin. Data are utilized for hatchery effectiveness and status and trends evaluations. Population status and trend monitoring of natural and hatchery origin fish is used for effective population management, assessing effectiveness of conservation actions, viability, and recovery metric monitoring.Please see protocols #2246, #2249 and #2250 for data analysis methods describing the calculation of metrics and indicators.
title: Nez Perce Tribe Spawning Ground Survey Data Collection
assumptions:
1. All redds are enumerated.

2. Females build one redd.

3. Carcasses are collected randomly and represent the unobserved individuals.
objectives: Obtain an index of spawner abundance (i.e. observed redds)
Obtain life history characteristics of spawners (i.e. age, sex, origin)
